titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Catherine Lanham Miller at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlestmt.author: Electronic finding aid encoded by Indiana University Libraries.

note.p: © 2019 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:31:17 -0500.

change.item: Encoded finding aid created by Katie Luhman.

did.abstract: The Miller, C. L. mss. (1951-1994) consist primarily of correspondence, articles, drafts, and manuscripts of journalist and author Catherine Lanham Miller.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Catherine Lanham Miller (1918-2003) was born in Greensburg, Indiana and graduated from Indiana University in 1938 with a bachelor of music degree. She then went on to teach for several years until beginning a career in writing. She wrote for publications such as The American Magazine, TV Guide Magazine, Good Housekeeping, Harper's Bazaar, Ladies' Home Journal, Philadelphia Inquirer, and House Beautiful. She also wrote several books, the most notable of which being How to Say Yes to Life: A Woman's Guide to Beating the Blahs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into three series: Correspondence, Writings, and Publicity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence concerning Miller's writings, as well as proposals, drafts, and manuscripts of her writings. In addition, there are some papers concerning publicity, such as lecture notes, events, and flyers.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See Norvelle mss. II, also located at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Miller, C. L. mss.], Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
